metadata.title: CVE-2023-6277 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
An out-of-memory flaw was found in libtiff. Passing a crafted tiff file toTIFFOpen() API may allow a remote attacker to cause a denial of service viaa craft input with size smaller than 379 KB.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-6277` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.10+esm5
libtiff-tools - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.10+esm5
libtiff5 - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.10+esm5
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.10+esm5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tiff package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.9-5ubuntu0.10+esm5').
